toBase<-function(Z,b){
 output<-as.character(c())
 while(Z > 0){
  r<-Z%%b
  output<-as.character(c(r, output))
  Z<-(Z-r)/b
 }
return(output)
}

#Want a baseToNumeric()? How bout 4!

#This one takes a number and a base as an argument and returns the printed number as a numeric. It has a dependency on the toBase() function.
baseToNumeric<-function(Z,b){return(as.numeric(paste(toBase(Z,b),collapse="")))}

#This one takes a string as an argument
baseToNumeric<-function(string){
  return(as.numeric(paste(string,collapse="")))
}

baseToNumeric<-function(Z,b){
 output<-as.character(c())
 while(Z > 0){
  r<-Z%%b
  output<-as.character(c(r, output))
  Z<-(Z-r)/b
 }
return(as.numeric(paste(output,collapse="")))
}

baseToNumeric<-function(Z,b, output=c(), hasRecursed=FALSE){
  if(Z==0 && !hasRecursed)
    return(0)
  else if (Z==0 && hasRecursed)
    return(as.numeric(paste(output,collapse="")))
  else {
  hasRecursed<-TRUE
  r<-Z%%b
  output<-as.character(c(r, output))
  baseToNumeric((Z-r)/b,b, output,hasRecursed)
  }
}
